snippet: Several trends in the golf world converged on the 18th green at Amata Spring Country Club in Thailand last Sunday when Guan Tianlang’s final five-foot par attempt disappeared into the hole.
abstract: Karen Crouse On Golf column observes that Guan Tianlang's victory in Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship, which qualified him for 2013 Masters, is one of several recent milestones for teenage Asian golf prodigies; notes that 14-year-old Guan will be the youngest competitor in storied Master's history, spurring many to question at what age is it appropriate to turn pro.
lead_paragraph: Several trends in the golf world converged on the 18th green at Amata Spring Country Club in Thailand last Sunday when Guan Tianlang’s final five-foot par attempt disappeared into the hole.

headline.seo: Guan Tianlang, Qualifying for Masters at 14, Is Part of a Trend
